TEXT.TITLE: TAIWAN TO RELAX IMPORT CURBS ON MORE GOODS
TEXT.BODY: Taiwan will relax import controls on more foreign goods, a government spokesman said today. The move was to allow greater access to Taiwan markets by overseas trading partners, especially the United States, an official of the Council for Economic Planning and Development told Reuters. Import curbs on about 400 foreign goods, including stationery and books, would soon be relaxed, he said. Taiwan announced it would ease curbs on some 600 farming and industrial products last month. The official said the moves were intended to balance trade between Taiwan and the United States and other trading partners. Taiwan's trade surplus reached a record 15.6 billion dlrs last year, up from 10.62 billion in 1985. Reuter
